results.title: Bayesian nonparametric clustering for spatio-temporal data, with an application to air pollution
results.abstract: This work reviews Bayesian nonparametric clustering methods for spatio-temporal data, focusing on their application to air pollution. It introduces modeling approaches for point-referenced spatio-temporal data and discusses recent advancements in Bayesian clustering, particularly spatial product partition models. The methods are illustrated on PM10 monitoring data from Northern Italy.

results.title: Robert Verity, Anne Cori, Swapnil Mishra, Seth Flaxman and Samir Bhatt's contribution to the Discussion of “Some statistical aspects of the Covid-19 response” by Wood et al
results.abstract: This paper discusses the statistical challenges and considerations that emerged during the COVID-19 pandemic, highlighting issues such as media distortions and the framing of risk and uncertainty. The authors reflect on these challenges to improve preparedness for future public health threats, questioning the flexibility of existing frameworks and introducing their own assumptions for addressing critical questions about the timing of infection peaks.

results.title: PointLCA-Net: Using Point Clouds for Energy Efficient Sparse Spatio-Temporal Signal Recognition in Neuromorphic Systems
results.abstract: This work presents PointLCA-Net, a novel energy-efficient architecture for recognizing sparse spatio-temporal signals in neuromorphic systems. The method treats these signals as 3D point clouds and uses a pre-trained PointNet to extract robust features. These features are then encoded and decoded by an Exemplar LCA-Decoder, which is suitable for in-memory computation on neuromorphic platforms. The proposed approach achieves high accuracy on datasets like DVS128 while significantly reducing energy consumption compared to other spiking neural networks, making it ideal for energy-constrained applications like UAVs and robotics.

results.title: STACI: Spatio-Temporal Aleatoric Conformal Inference
results.abstract: This paper introduces STACI, a novel framework for spatio-temporal analysis that combines a variational Bayesian neural network approximation of a non-stationary spatio-temporal Gaussian Process with a spatio-temporal conformal inference algorithm. STACI is highly scalable and provides statistically valid prediction intervals for uncertainty quantification. The method outperforms competing Gaussian Process and deep learning models in approximating spatio-temporal processes and can be scaled to datasets with millions of observations.

results.title: Synthetic Datasets for Machine Learning on Spatio-Temporal Graphs using PDEs
results.abstract: This paper addresses the scarcity of high-quality datasets for spatio-temporal graph machine learning by proposing a method to generate synthetic datasets using partial differential equations (PDEs). The authors create three datasets modeling epidemiology, atmospheric particles, and tsunami waves. They demonstrate the utility of these datasets by benchmarking several machine learning models and showing that pre-training on this synthetic data can improve performance on real-world epidemiological data. The provided methodology and datasets enable researchers to create customized benchmarks for various applications.
